subject: Re: Test Coverage as a Metric
msgSnippet: ... I think I should say a bit more.  All business functionallity should be 100% test covered.  Business functionallity should be fully test driven.    So if

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Dave Astels <dave@s...>" <dave@s...> wrote:
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbr@d...> wrote:
> > So said  Curt Sampson  on  2003-02-06 --------------------
> > 
> > >On Tue, 4 Feb 2003, Scott Stirling wrote:
> 
> > >Yes, Kent Beck indeed did say, "TDD followed religiously should 
> > >result in 100% statement coverage."
> 
> That's pretty religious.  And not completely pragmatic.  Should you
> test drive toSting() methods that you want for nice test failure
> reports?  There are bits & piecs that very likely will slip through
> untested.  Some aren't a problem. 

I think I should say a bit more.  All business functionallity should
be 100% test covered.  Business functionallity should be fully test
driven.    So if you need a toString() for a business purpose, e.g.
for rendering something in a listbox, then it should be test driven. 
If it's just for inspecting or test message output, then I generally
wouldn't bother.

Dave
